definition: poached egg/egg fried on both sides
Holland/the Netherlands/abbr. for 荷蘭|荷兰[He2 lan2]
to carry on one's shoulder or back/burden/responsibility
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: He had a light breakfast of poached eggs and tea.
sentences.chinese: 他早餐就吃了點水煮荷包蛋，喝了點茶。

sentences.english: So your poached egg preference sets you apart from the hardboiled fans at home.
sentences.chinese: 常喫荷包蛋已經讓你遠離享用水煮蛋的樂趣了。

sentences.english: Poached eggs on toast are very nice
sentences.chinese: 荷包蛋和土司非常的美味。

sentences.english: Would you like your eggs sunny-side up?
sentences.chinese: 您要一面煎黃的荷包蛋嗎？

sentences.english: He poached an egg for breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 他的早飯是水煮荷包蛋。

sentences.english: B. Sunny side up, please. But, I don't like the white being runny .
sentences.chinese: 煎一面的荷包蛋，但蛋白不要稀的。

sentences.english: I would like a poached egg.

definition: plain cooked rice/rice with nothing to go with it
tea egg (egg boiled with flavorings which may include black tea)
